jx.jx_en_mean: archaic way of saying all of a sudden
jx.jx_cn_mean: (古)。 同 all of a sudden
突然地：非常迅速地和突然地；出乎意料地

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French sudein, from an alteration of Latin subitaneus, from subitus 'sudden'

entry.def: Sudden means happening quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: He had been deeply affected by the sudden death of his father-in-law...
example.tran: 岳父的猝死使他十分伤心。

example.ex: 'I hope,' the stranger said, 'that the sudden change of venue did not inconvenience you.'...
example.tran: 那位陌生人说：“我希望突然改变地点不会给您带来不便。”

entry.def: If something happens all of a sudden, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: All of a sudden she didn't look sleepy any more.
example.tran: 她突然看起来一点都不困了。

means.word_mean: 1. happening without warning or in a short space of time;

auth_sentence.content: Calls is full of brooding space and sudden runs.

auth_sentence.content: So, apologies to them for my sudden elevation.
auth_sentence.res_content: So, apologies to them for my sudden elevation.

Sentence.sentence: It went bankrupt all of a sudden.
It usually appears all of a sudden.

sentences.en: The sudden arrival of guests forced her to change her plans.
sentences.cn: 客人们的突然到来迫使她改变了计划。

sentences.en: He was sudden in his actions.

jushi.english: A sudden wind swept a pile of leaves in.
jushi.chinese: 突然吹起一阵风,刮进一堆树叶来。

jushi.english: We were shattered to hear of her sudden death.
jushi.chinese: 听到她突然死了,我们都感到震惊。

jushi.english: She was seized with a sudden desire to laugh, at a most unsuitable moment in the performance.
jushi.chinese: 在演出中最不该笑的时候,她突然想笑。
